item.title: Serving This Site
item.description: Somewhat predictably, the first thing I took care on here after making that "plans going forward" list was not even featured on said list: setting up HTTPS. To be honest, I'm 100% faking it at the moment, but seeing as it's a static site that doesn't handle anything critical, I really just wanted people to be subtly reassured by the little lock in the address bar. I set up "flexible" HTTPS (including redirects from bare HTTP URLs) and caching with a free-tier Cloudflare account.

item.title: Building This Site
item.description: I shopped around a little before deciding to use Hugo as the generator for my site. I'd been meaning to give Gutenberg a chance for a while, and Hakyll appeals to the part of my brain that likes taking painfully abstract math courses, but in the end I decided to go for something a bit more established and popular. One of the perks of Hugo is Org mode support as a drop in replacement for Markdown.

item.title: Genesis
item.description: At a truly inopportune time, I've decided to finally get this site going again. I'm already spending too much time tinkering with personal projects instead of class assignments, but at least with this I'll have something I made to point to. This site used to be up as a sort of mini-resume, but I let it slide into obselesence and killed it rather than leave an inaccurate site up without the time or motivation to maintain it.
